title: Renal Cell Carcinoma: Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Approach
short_description: Clinical document describing renal cell carcinoma symptoms, risk factors, epidemiology, and diagnostic methods.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of renal cell carcinoma, a form of kidney cancer. The document covers the clinical presentation including both asymptomatic cases and symptomatic presentations such as hematuria, abdominal pain, weight loss, and other systemic symptoms. It discusses epidemiological factors including male predominance, smoking history, and familial clustering, noting approximately 30,000 new cases annually in the United States. The document also outlines diagnostic approaches using imaging studies like CT and abdominal ultrasonography, along with blood and urine testing for clinical evaluation.
